hedline.hl1: Coming to Work in Jeans In a March of Dimes Drive

abstract.p: Almost 40 offices in Westchester County (NY) sign up to participate in March of Dimes Blue Jeans for Babies drive; employees, in exchange for donation, will be allowed to wear jeans for a day (S)

block.p: Starting Friday, some businesses will look more laid back, thanks to the March of Dimes Blue Jeans for Babies drive.
With a donation, participating employees receive a button ($5) or T-shirt ($7) bearing the campaign logo, which entitles them to wear jeans for a day.
Starting Friday, some businesses will look more laid back, thanks to the March of Dimes Blue Jeans for Babies drive.
With a donation, participating employees receive a button ($5) or T-shirt ($7) bearing the campaign logo, which entitles them to wear jeans for a day.

So far almost 40 offices in the county have signed up, including normally buttoned-up businesses like Fleet Bank, Allstate Insurance Company, Chase Manhattan Bank and Salomon Smith Barney, whose Mount Kisco office takes part.

''It's a fantastic cause, plus it's fun to watch people who usually put on $1,000 dollar suits wearing the same thing as everybody else,'' said Carolyn Koelln, a technical support adviser for Salomon Smith Barney.

Companies like HealthSouth Physical Therapy, whose employees always dress down, will also take part. They are welcome to dress down further, by perhaps wearing pajamas, the local coordinator, Annette Trotta, said. Those interested in registering can call Ms. Trotta at (914) 997-4730.
